ST. LOUIS • Authorities suspect an arsonist is to blame for the fire that gutted a Popeyes chicken restaurant in the 3600 block of Gravois Avenue late Thursday night.
The person who reported the fire called from a cell phone at about 11:30 p.m. Thursday, saying there had been an explosion and someone was injured, said Capt. Dan Sutter of the St. Louis Fire Department.
When firefighters arrived, they found no signs of an explosion and no one injured, Sutter said. But the black smoke pouring from the one-story commercial building was so thick and drifting into the street that crews had difficulty seeing across Gravois, Sutter added.
Katie O'Sullivan, a spokeswoman for the St. Louis Police Department, said the fire is being investigated as an arson. She said police had no suspects.
The Popeyes restaurant is at 3665 Gravois Avenue, in the city's Tower Grove South neighborhood.
